command:
import hashlib, difflib, os

iso = "/root/system_image.iso"
base = "/root/baselines/system_image.iso.sha256"

h = hashlib.sha256()
with open(iso, "rb") as f:
    for ch in iter(lambda: f.read(1024 * 1024), b""):
        h.update(ch)
curr = h.hexdigest()
exp = open(base).read().strip().split()[0]
print("\n".join(difflib.unified_diff([exp + "\n"], [curr + "\n"], fromfile="baseline_iso_sha256", tofile="current_iso_sha256")) or ("OK: " + os.path.basename(iso)))
explanation: Validates the SHA-256 of a system installation ISO against a baseline, confirming the image hasn't been maliciously altered pre-deployment.
rationale_steps: Read the entire ISO and compute its SHA-256.
Compare the resulting hash with a known-good baseline.
Report differences to detect tampering of the system image.
